page.title: 16A Former Headmistress(cont.)
page.content: the children could help with the Harvest.This continued during the food shortage until 1947. Two of the most important changes she can remember were the extensions and the provision of flush toilets together with hot and cold water for washing. Before that the children had to use bucket-type toilets outside and a pump in the yard for washing. Today, the things she notices that have changed are the increase in the number and variety of books,particularly for reference, the vast improvement in the space for outside play and games and the wearing of a school uniform. She doesn'think that the behaviour and manners of the children have changed much over the years but life in the village has. For example very few people who live locally actually work in the area.They have become commuters
